meanings.definition: A person who interrupts a performer or public speaker with derisive or aggressive comments.
meanings.sent1: The heckler in the audience kept shouting rude comments during the comedy show.
meanings.sent2: The stand-up comedian was annoyed by the heckler who disrupted his jokes.
meanings.sent3: The heckler's comments were so mean that even the other audience members felt uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The heckler's words were like sharp arrows, piercing through the performer's confidence.
meanings.sent5: The heckler stood out in the crowd, his voice cutting through the silence of the theater.

meanings.definition: To interrupt a performer or public speaker with derisive or aggressive comments.
meanings.sent1: Please don't heckler the speaker while he is trying to share his ideas.
meanings.sent2: The audience member decided to heckler the singer during her performance.
meanings.sent3: The children thought it would be funny to heckler their teacher during the school play.
meanings.sent4: His constant hecklering made it difficult for the presenter to continue with the seminar.
meanings.sent5: The group of protestors began to heckler the politician as soon as he started his speech.
